data.title: Book your tour today!
data.text: #1 to do list for 1st time visitor to Charleston.  I enjoyed the walking tour very much and  the weather was just perfect.  Our tour guide is very knowledgeable and sharing as much history of Charleston with us.  There are so many well known events but at the same time she shared many "little" Charleston histories with us that would take days and weeks.   Myself and tour guide cannot emphasis enough on the importance of African-Americans contributions to American history and they are sure under valued and appreciated.

data.title: Fantastic Tour of Historic Charleston!
data.text: Fran was a fantastic tour guide, sharing her knowledge and stories of Charleston.  If you are looking for an easy stroll and soaking in all the history I highly recommend doing this tour!  Thank you Fran and hope you were not affected by the floods.

data.title: Excellent overview of Charleston's History
data.text: Fran, a Charleston native, led the tour.  Her passion for her hometown showed.  Her narration was informative.  I especially enjoyed her pointing out what now differed from her childhood as it showed how dedicated the City is to preservation.  Our group was entirely international, excepting me, & it was enjoyable as a Southerner to hear the all the appreciative comments.

data.title: Amazing walk!
data.text:
We took this tour our first day in Charleston. It was incredible! We had some time earlier in the day to acquaint ourselves with Historic Downtown but it really came to life when we took this tour with Dave. He had so many stories and pointed out the city's ornate details that you miss if you don't know where to look. 

This tour is a must for first-time visitors and we will probably do it again next time we visit Charleston.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: This walking tour tours Historic Downtown Charleston. It takes you about two+ hours. I I highly recommend. Our tour guide was excellent. She was very knowledgeable and energetic. She went into quite a bit of depth on the information. Very enjoyable. So much to see, but she explained it all very well.

data.title: Excellent Tour
data.text: This tour takes you around Historic Downtown Charleston by foot. It takes you about an hour and 45 minutes and I would highly recommend. Our tour guide was excellent (I wish I could remember her name, she wore a white beach hat). She was very knowledgeable and energetic. So much to see, but she explained it all so well.

data.title: Nice, balanced walking tour
data.text:
A former history teacher led our group.
He did a very nice job. 
He sought shade whenever possible, pointed out the better attractions to come back to (which coincided with what the hotel concierge had told me), and took the group past restrooms.

data.title: Interesting and fascinating historic walking tour
data.text: A great way to start the day. Very  informative and good to learn some local history about the place you are visiting. So many historical events occurred here. Thoroughly enjoyable, good guide.

data.title: Very informative
data.text: We did the 10 am tour with Beth she was funny and easy to understand. She told us about the most important detailes of the city. Beth you are amazing and funny.

data.title: Lovely and informative tour!
data.text: We went on the 10 am tour with Fran and it was so lovely! It was very informative and took us all over the heart of Charleston. Fran was sure to keep us in the shade and made sure we brought water. The walking was not anything challenging, and there was a lot of stopping and explaining. I felt very knowledgable about the city after the tour, and recommend it to anyone visiting Charleston, even if it's not your first visit!

data.title: Charleston strolls history tour
data.text: excellent intro to charleston. Our tour guide Mary was so knowledgable and had answers to any questions we had. She was excellent

data.title: Wonderful Tour
data.text: We went on the afternoon tour with Frannie and were glad we did. The tour was well organized and she was very knowledgeable about the history of the city and the architecture of the many buildings on the tour. It was an excellent way to learn about Charleston from its colonial beginnings through the Civil War period to the devastation of Hurricane Hugo in 1989. The tour lasted over the two hours but no one objected as Fran kept us entertained with her great storytelling. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would highly recommend this tour. A great Introduction to the city & all it has to offer.

data.title: Highly recommended!
data.text:
We went on this tour just a couple hours after we touched down in Charleston.  We are so glad we did!

Beth was so knowledgable and gave such a comprehensive account of history, architecture, and a general layout of the historic district.

We couldn't believe the two hours went by so fast - we could have listened to her all day.

We had fun, and we learned so much in such a short time.  It was a perfect way to start our trip.  Then we went back and toured all the house museums, etc., since we felt we had s good foundation already.

Great tour!!

data.title: true history at its best professionally delivered
data.text: The tour was very organized, on time, full of historical information and professionally delivered. Our tour guide, Beth was very knowledgeable, patient and attentive to our queries. She packed a plethora of information in  the short 2 hours available. The tour begins from a GREAT location and is extremely organized. I HIGHLY recommend this tour be taken before and above all others.

data.title: a must do on your first day
data.text: i highly recommend walking tours to get a feel of the history of the city you visit. this one we found at the visitor's center and buying the tickets there got us a $2 discount per ticket. Frannie was our tour guide and she was fabulous. great storytelling and so much great information about charleston from its foundation to current times. from why so many homes have gardens to why the sides of homes face the street to earthquake bolts to the four corners of law,  it was all great and held my attention the whole time. definitely bring your camera as you walk by numerous historical sites like rainbow row.

data.title: Great storytelling
data.text: Fran was an excellent tour guide! She made the history of Charleston come alive through her excellent storytelling and interesting details. She did a great job with the little kids on our tour, keeping them engaged and participating. I highly recommend a walking historical tour with Charleston Strolls!

data.title: Nice walk and history
data.text: These history walks are all fairly similar depends on your guide. Had a nice lady named Frann who did a great job relating the history of Charleston.  Worth the money if you haven't done one before.

data.title: Fantastic journey
data.text: Mary read great! She's an encyclopedia of knowledge and the tour was jam packed with fascinating information. She is a native and her enthusiasm I'd apparent throughout the walk. This is a must for new visitors.

data.title: 1st time visitor to Charleston
data.text: What an amazing way to see and learn about Historic Charleston.   We met our guide at the Mills House Hotel and did a leisurely stroll through the streets.   Our guide Dave was amazing he was so knowledgeable and informative about the history of this city.   He took us to the waterfront and told us the highlights of the civil war and the role Charleston played.    We also did a carriage ride which took us to a different section of the City so doing both was great.    The walking tour my husband and I would highly recommend if you have to choose walking or riding.

data.title: This is a MUSTon your Charleston itinerary!
data.text: What a fun & educational morning.  We met at the Mills Hotel ... a small group of about 15 folks from California to New Jersey.  Lisa Berezny was our tour guide ... a native Charleston resident with a quick wit, voluminous historical knowlege, delightful insights on the city and just an all around great tour guide.  You don't want to miss this tour ... you will see soo much more than when you do the carriage or shuttle tours.  Treat yourself to this tour as the perfect way to kick off your Charleston vacation & make sure you ask for Lisa!
